Home → News → Libraries collecting for foodbanks this Christmas

Libraries collecting for foodbanks this Christmas

Written by Alice Violett · Published Dec 5, 2017

If you are able to help people in need this Christmas, several of our libraries are acting as foodbank collection points.

  • Bungay Library hosts a local foodbank collection point all year round.
  • Elmswell Library is collecting for Gatehouse Foodbank in Bury St Edmunds.
  • Gainsborough Community Library is collecting for a local foodbank and are also hosting the Scouts’ Christmas postbox.
  • Ipswich County Library is collecting non-perishables, socks and men’s toiletries for Families in Need Ipswich.
  • Kessingland Library hosts a local foodbank collection point all year round.
  • Southwold Library hosts a local foodbank collection point all year round and is also collecting hats for the YMCA’s Hats for the Homeless campaign.
  • Stowmarket Library is collecting for Stowmarket Foodbank.

You can also help raise money for good causes at Woodbridge Library, where there is a Scout and Guide Christmas postbox.
